section.name: Introduction
section.p: Parallel Java (PJ) is an API and middleware for parallel programming in 100% Java on shared memory multiprocessor (SMP) parallel computers, cluster parallel computers, and hybrid SMP cluster parallel computers. PJ was developed by Professor Alan Kaminsky and his student Luke McOmber in the Department of Computer Science at the Rochester Institute of Technology.
Please see the PJ websitefor further information.
This version of PJ includes minor modifications compared to the original.
Jacob Litman at the Schnieders Lab in the Department of Biochemistry at the University of Iowa added a mechanism for shutdown and garbage collection of ParallelTeams.
